remarks:
The sum of two positive reals is greater than one of them.  Proposition 9-3.5(iii) of [Gleason] p. 123.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1996.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

 The sum of two positive reals is greater than one of them.  Proposition 9-3.5(iii) of [Gleason] p. 123.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1996.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2013.)
statement: ltaddpr $p |- ( ( A e. P. /\ B e. P. ) -> A
